channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Devon Avenue abandoned frame from road sign on the grass verge, 22nd November
item.description:
Looks like it’s been there a while, this could be a trip hazard

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 41 Devon Avenue, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Subsidence.Winchcombe side of Cleeve Hill, 22nd November
item.description:
ROAD WORKS were there for sometime,several months ago.But there is BAD Subsidence now getting worse all the time.Especially when it rains.Its by the entry to the lay by just up from Postlip.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): B4632, Winchcombe
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dilapidated motorway fencing, 22nd November
item.description:
Good morning, the motorway fencing running alongside mine and my neighbours livestock farms is rotting and leaning at 45 degrees. I’ve straightened it in one place with my own stakes but it’s now going in several place, so at the very least requires a temporary fix as livestock are in constant contact.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): M5, Churchdown
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipped mirror door for bedroom wardrobe Britten place, 22nd November
item.description:
Broken mirror glass on pavement clearly left my contractor

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 8 Britten Place, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Potholes on edge of road used as passing place, 20th November
item.description:
The location is the double bend on mill lane on the right hand side ging towards Glenfall House. The bend is both a pinch point and a passing place where there is no option but to use the side / verge of the road and to come off the road in the entrance to a field. This road is well used and at the location a high level of trying to pass on what is a blind corner occurs. A deep pothole has opened up on the verge of the road and the entrance to the field has also been eroded with a hole appearing. Please can these be mended.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Mill Lane, Charlton Kings
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocking the pavement and access to park, 20th November
item.description:
Parking outside of working hours for the last few weeks. Causing children and dog walkers to walk in the road in order to access the park.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 37 Pecked Lane, Bishops Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road damage, 19th November
item.description:
Deep ditch in side of road

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 36 Hungerford Street, Cheltenham

item.title: Numerous potholes down middle of carriageway, 19th November
item.description:
Between Norwood Arms and the traffic lights cross road junction, on shurdington road. At least one must be ‘dangerous’ as it really made my suspension bang when I drove over it, in the dark it was not possible to see this danger.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 104 Painswick Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road safety outside entrance to school, 18th November
item.description:
This entrance of the school as been used since the pandemic began and the school will continue to use it. There are approximately 180 children with their parents entering and leaving from this entrance each school day. It needs safer road markings, signs and could do with better parking and driver enforcement, slower speed, and a lolly pop lady/man.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 17a Church Street, Charlton Kings
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter and domestic appliance, 18th November
item.description:
Litter has been accumulating for months in the little carpark on Falkland Place. The domestic appliance and cuddly toy have been there for several weeks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 116 Hester's Way Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Estate Agent for sale board blocking pavement, 18th November
item.description:
There is an estate agent partly on verge pertruding into pavement making it dangerous
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 9 Friars Close, Cheltenham

item.title: Overgrown hedge and tree obscuring street lights, 17th November
item.description:
Two streetlights opposite numbers 40/41/42 Grange Drive are obscured by overgrown hedge and tree. There is a danger of being damage by the tree in high winds. The street lights are maintained by Glos Highways and the vegetation by Tewkesbury BC. This area was left out of the most recent round of maintenance by TBC.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 42 Grange Drive, Bishops Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Foliage covering traffic lights, 17th November
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Suffolk House 68-70 Suffolk Road, Cheltenham

item.description:
All the way along. Falling apart in places!

item.title: Large amounts of litter on verge, 16th November
item.description:
1 bin has been provided - which obviously isn't sufficient and isn't emptied regularly. There's a massive pile of rubbish next to it. Please can you clean it and put in a bigger bin. Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): A40, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 1 Saint Paul's Road, Cheltenham

item.title: Water coming up out of drain cover at side of road, 14th November
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Dowdeswell
